heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 21 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.3°C) and outside temperature (up 3.4°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 273 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 45.2°C), feels like temperature (up 48.7°C), and outside temperature (up 47.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 272.9m lower than yesterday, 66.6m higher than the past week, 190.8m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 1011m to 4080m and averaged 1919.5m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and some sunny spells will occur. High pressure suggests settled weather.
